meanings.definition: Emitting or relating to the emission of ionizing radiation
meanings.sent1: The scientist wore a special suit to handle the radioactive material.
meanings.sent2: The radioactive substance glowed in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally knocked over the radioactive vial, causing chaos in the lab.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a radioactive beacon, drawing everyone's attention.
meanings.sent5: The radioactive spider bite gave him superpowers.

meanings.definition: Containing or capable of emitting ionizing radiation
meanings.sent1: The lead box was used to shield people from the radioactive rocks inside.
meanings.sent2: The barrel was labeled as radioactive waste.
meanings.sent3: The radioactive cupcakes were a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: His words were like radioactive seeds, spreading fear among the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The radioactive glow of the watch made it easy to read in the dark.

meanings.sent1: The substance decayed radioactively over time.

meanings.sent3: The cake batter mixed radioactively as she stirred it vigorously.
